title: Playing (tanky) support champs in ranked?
body: I recently started playing ranked again and felt like I was doing something wrong even though I win, A example of this would be a braum game I had 4 days or so ago where I went 0/9/20, I have this mindset from past experiences that dying as a tank support isn't that bad but is it really? So wanted to ask if there was anything I could improve on. (check my match history)

replies.body:
As a thresh main, i can confirm this feeling

As the tank it is your job to absorb damage, if you die, but your team out-trades like 3 for 1 its not so bad, but if you're dying and nothing is being gained, its bad, the idea is to die for your team if you do, sacrificing for a fed team member is good also (IMO) 

for example i had 7/1 ez by 10 mins, i was 1/2/6 we got 3 manned on bot lane, i died and distracted the enemy team long enough for him to get away (maybe just in low elo), he then ulted from spawn getting a double in mid lane
Dying certainly isn't good as a support but doesn't directly correlate with losing a fight or the game

Braum Tactic Rick
1. Bait, you know when to do it (your team is squishy and hangs back). Deliberately set yourself up like you got picked. 
2. Absorb multiple enemy ultimates and key cooldowns
3. Get your ult out, your E up and q. Also activate exhaust if you are about to die and your activate your locket of solari.

That right there can win team fights and games

There is even the chance that you will be able to escape with your W.


If you are ahead, don't bother with this tactic. An ahead braum rarely dies.

4 S+ this split and counting!

Note: If you get all your spells off in any team fight as braum and absorbed a lot of damage. you have already done 90% of your job. All you have left to do should you survive is go around taging as many enemy champs as you can till your spells come back up (passive stuns)

Dying as a tank sup is fine because it usually means that you died to stop someone else dying. Dying as a healing sup is worse than dying as a tank one (cos healing sups are never supposed to be taking the hits.)

Personally i don't think that there is any other kind of support to play in ranked other than tanks ones (because in this cancer assassin meta, no one else ever picks a tank, so the task always fall to you)
